Posts.Content: buyo wrote: How long does chemo brain last? I had it real bad during dose dense AC. It was a little better during T. My last chemo was 5/6/10. I feel much more clear headed, but my brain still does not work right! There will be times when I'm talking, and the wrong words come out of my mouth. Sometimes I can't even think of the word I want. I'm extremely forgetful and easily distracted. I'm begining to think chemo has caused permenant brain damage (or that I might have a brain tumor)! Has anyone else have this problem for this long, or am I the only one? Dx 10/29/2009, ILC/IDC, 1cm, Stage IA, Grade 3, 0/1 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- (FISH) Surgery Lumpectomy; Mastectomy Chemotherapy AC + T (Taxol) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Chemo brain after chemo buyo pickle

Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2010 06:20PM buyo wrote: Thanks for the replies. I'm so worried I have a serious problem that I've scheduled an appointment with my onc (I'm only supposed to see him every 6 months). His nurse said I shouldn't be having these extreme symptoms four months out. I'm afraid I have a brain tumor, as my cancer was triple negative. It's so frustrating and embarrassing!
Posts.Title: Chemo brain after chemo buyo pickle
